definition: to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure

sentences.english: Life is not all beer and skittles, still love.
sentences.chinese: 生活並非只是喫喝玩樂，還有戀愛。

sentences.english: Life is not all cakes and ale.
sentences.chinese: 人生並不就是喫喝玩樂。

sentences.english: Life is not all beer and skittles .
sentences.chinese: 人生並不完全是喫喝玩樂。

sentences.english: His  spirit was vitiated by pleasure seeking.
sentences.chinese: 他的志氣因追求喫喝玩樂而消磨殆盡。

sentences.english: Time flies when you're having fun.
Guys and Dolls crowded under the dim light with drinking, dancing, having fun.
sentences.chinese: 昏暗燈光下的紅男綠女擠在一起喝酒，跳舞，玩樂。

sentences.english: Here’s an example: a few weeks ago my partner won a couple of thousand Dollars playing lotto.
sentences.chinese: 比如，幾周前，我的夥計玩樂透中了幾千美元的獎。
他們對無聊的玩樂不感興趣。

sentences.english: Are you studying hard, or are you having fun?
sentences.chinese: 你是在努力學習還是在盡情玩樂呢？

sentences.english: Play hard , study hard , and work hard.
sentences.chinese: 盡情玩樂，用功讀書，努力工作。

sentences.english: Can we have no higher aim in life than mere pleasure-seeking?
sentences.chinese: 我們難道沒有比喫喝玩樂更高的人生目標嗎？

sentences.english: Peking man speaks Chinese New Year is the beer and skittles, give priority to in order to eat.
sentences.chinese: 北京人過年講得就是喫喝玩樂，以喫爲主。

sentences.english: Thus, we become friends, and he took me played around the island, eating the seafood that tourist won't have chance to eat.
sentences.chinese: 於是朋友便交上了，之後更一起在蘭嶼喫喝玩樂。

sentences.english: There was no after-theatre lark, however, so far as Carrie was concerned.
sentences.chinese: 然而，就嘉莉而言，不存在什麼散場後的玩樂。

sentences.english: But promoting play can be surprisingly challenging to parents.
sentences.chinese: 但倡導玩樂對家長來說是個意外的挑戰。

sentences.english: Most telling, the purpose of the pavilion in the garden was misunderstood as a place for frivolous pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數的敘述中，亭臺的作用被曲解爲玩樂的地方。

definition: to amuse oneself/to have fun/to go sightseeing/to take a stroll
to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
